title: Tyson Fury rooting for Anthony Joshua in rematch bout with Andy Ruiz Jr
text:
Tyson Fury has admitted he is rooting for Anthony Joshua in his upcoming crunch rematch with Andy Ruiz Jnr, in order for a showcase fight with himself to be put back on the cards.

Joshua is set to go up against the Mexican heavyweight champion once again on December 7, when the duo meet in Saudi Arabia.

Fury, who also happens to be preparing for his first venture into WWE next week, insists he want's Joshua to get his career back on track with victory... but will happily dispatch of Ruiz himself if not.

Tyson Fury took to Good Morning Britain on Friday wearing a rather garish boxing suit

The boxing superstar admitted he was rooting for Anthony Joshua to win his rematch clash

Fury's typically extravagant suit features images of iconic boxers from throughout the eras

Fury's charm and humour came across as he discussed both his and Joshua's near future

Meanwhile Fury is preparing for a bizarre WWE showdown with Braun Strowman next week

Fury took to the sofa on Friday morning, to feature in an interview with ITV's Good Morning Britain, wearing a garish suit.

Designed by Claudio Lugli, the suit was comprised of a series of images of famous boxers throughout the different eras.

'I hope he gets his belts back because it makes a massive fight between me and him. But if he doesn’t then I will just have to go and beat up Andy Ruiz Jr,' said Fury during the chat.

'If Deontay loses in November against Luis Ortiz, I would take the winner of AJ vs Ruiz Jr in February or March.' added Fury.

Fury is no stranger to a loud suit and was previously kitted out in this shirt and jacket combo

It has been noted how much weight Joshua has shed in the build-up to the event, in order to increase his mobility and prevent early fatigue of the muscles.

Fury, however, thinks this will make things all the more interesting.

'They have both lost quite a bit of weight and I think it will be a fantastic fight, the first one was although it did not go the way everyone was expecting.

'These big upset-rematches are always great to watch.'

Fury will wrestle Braun Strowman in WWE in Saudi Arabia on October 31, while he waits for Deontay Wilder to defend his WBC crown against Luis Ortiz on November 23.

The British heavyweight likes to stand out from the crowd and has his outfits tailor made
